member.name: IImageList.Add
member.summary: Adds an image or images to an image list.
member.param: A handle to the bitmap that contains the image or images. The number of images is inferred from the width of the bitmap.
A handle to the bitmap that contains the mask. If no mask is used with the image list, this parameter is ignored.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to the index of the first new image. If the method fails to successfully add the new image, this value is -1.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.AddMasked
member.summary: Adds an image or images to an image list, generating a mask from the specified bitmap.
member.param: A handle to the bitmap that contains one or more images. The number of images is inferred from the width of the bitmap.

The color used to generate the mask. Each pixel of this color in the specified bitmap is changed to black, and the corresponding bit in the mask is set to 1. If this parameter is CLR_DEFAULT, then the color of the pixel at (0,0) is used as the mask.
A pointer to an int that contains the index of the first new image when it returns, if successful, or -1 otherwise.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.BeginDrag
member.summary: Begins dragging an image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image to drag.
A value of type int that contains the x-component of the drag position relative to the upper-left corner of the image.
A value of type int that contains the y-component of the drag position relative to the upper-left corner of the image.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.Clone
member.summary: Clones an existing image list.
member.param: An IID for the new image list.
The address of a pointer to the interface for the new image list.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.Copy
member.summary: Copies images from a given image list.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the zero-based index of the destination image for the copy operation.
A pointer to the interface for the source image list.
A value of type int that contains the zero-based index of the source image for the copy operation.
A value that specifies the type of copy operation to be made.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.DragEnter
member.summary: Locks updates to the specified window during a drag operation and displays the drag image at the specified position within the window.
member.param: A handle to the window that owns the drag image.
The x-coordinate at which to display the drag image. The coordinate is relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area.
The y-coordinate at which to display the drag image. The coordinate is relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.DragLeave
member.summary: Unlocks the specified window and hides the drag image, which enables the window to update.
member.param: A handle to the window that contains the drag image.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.DragMove
member.summary: Moves the image that is being dragged during a drag-and-drop operation. This function is typically called in response to a WM_MOUSEMOVE message.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the x-coordinate where the drag image appears. The coordinate is relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area.
A value of type int that contains the y-coordinate where the drag image appears. The coordinate is relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.DragShowNolock
member.summary: Shows or hides the image being dragged.
member.param: A value that specifies whether to show or hide the image being dragged. Specify TRUE to show the image or FALSE to hide the image.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.Draw
member.summary: Draws an image list item in the specified device context.
member.param: A pointer to an structure that contains the drawing parameters.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.EndDrag
member.summary: Ends a drag operation.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.GetBkColor
member.summary: Gets the current background color for an image list.
member.param: A pointer to a COLORREF that contains the background color when the method returns.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.GetDragImage
member.summary: Gets the temporary image list that is used for the drag image. The function also retrieves the current drag position and the offset of the drag image relative to the drag position.
member.param: A pointer to a structure that receives the current drag position. Can be NULL.
A pointer to a structure that receives the offset of the drag image relative to the drag position. Can be NULL.
An IID for the image list.
The address of a pointer to the interface for the image list if successful, NULL otherwise.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.GetIcon
member.summary: Creates an icon from an image and a mask in an image list.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image.
A combination of flags that specify the drawing style. For a list of values, see .
A pointer to an int that contains the handle to the icon if successful, or NULL if otherwise.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.GetIconSize
member.summary: Gets the dimensions of images in an image list. All images in an image list have the same dimensions.
member.param: A pointer to an int that receives the width, in pixels, of each image.
A pointer to an int that receives the height, in pixels, of each image.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.GetImageCount
member.summary: Gets the number of images in an image list.
member.param: A pointer to an int that contains the number of images when the method returns.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.GetImageInfo
member.summary: Gets information about an image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image.
A pointer to an structure that receives information about the image. The information in this structure can directly manipulate the bitmaps of the image.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.GetImageRect
member.summary: Gets an image's bounding rectangle.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image.
A pointer to a RECT that contains the bounding rectangle when the method returns.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.GetItemFlags
member.summary: Gets the flags of an image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the images whose flags need to be retrieved.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: A pointer to a DWORD that contains the flags when the method returns. One of the following values:

listheader.description: Indicates that the item in the imagelist has an alpha channel.
Windows Vista and later. Indicates that the item in the imagelist was generated via a StretchBlt function, consequently image quality may have degraded.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.GetOverlayImage
member.summary: Retrieves a specified image from the list of images used as overlay masks.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the one-based index of the overlay mask.

A pointer to an int that receives the zero-based index of
an image in the image list. This index identifies the image that is used as an overlay mask.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.Merge
member.summary: Creates a new image by combining two existing images. This method also creates a new image list in which to store the image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the first existing image.
A pointer to the interface of the image list that contains the second image.
A value of type int that contains the index of the second existing image.
A value of type int that contains the x-component of the offset of the second image relative to the first image.
A value of type int that contains the y-component of the offset of the second image relative to the first image.
An IID of the interface for the new image list.
A raw pointer to the interface for the new image list.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.Remove
member.summary: Removes an image from an image list.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image to remove. If this parameter is -1, the method removes all images.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.Replace
member.summary: Replaces an image in an image list with a new image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image to replace.
A handle to the bitmap that contains the image.
A handle to the bitmap that contains the mask. If no mask is used with the image list, this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.ReplaceIcon
member.summary: Replaces an image with an icon or cursor.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image to replace. If i is -1, the function adds the image to the end of the list.
A handle to the icon or cursor that contains the bitmap and mask for the new image.
A pointer to an int that will contain the index of the image on return if successful, or -1 otherwise.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.SetBkColor
member.summary: Sets the background color for an image list. This method only functions if you add an icon to the image list or use the method to add a black and white bitmap. Without a mask, the entire image draws, and the background color is not visible.
member.param: The background color to set. If this parameter is set to CLR_NONE, then images draw transparently using the .
A pointer to a COLORREF that contains the previous background color on return if successful, or CLR_NONE otherwise.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.SetDragCursorImage
member.summary: Creates a new drag image by combining the specified image, which is typically a mouse cursor image, with the current drag image.
member.param: A pointer to the interface that accesses the image list interface, which contains the new image to combine with the drag image.
A value of type int that contains the index of the new image to combine with the drag image.
A value of type int that contains the x-component of the hot spot within the new image.
A value of type int that contains the x-component of the hot spot within the new image.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.SetIconSize
member.summary: Sets the dimensions of images in an image list and removes all images from the list.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the width, in pixels, of the images in the image list. All images in an image list have the same dimensions.
A value of type int that contains the height, in pixels, of the images in the image list. All images in an image list have the same dimensions.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.SetImageCount
member.summary: Resizes an existing image list.
member.param: A value that specifies the new size of the image list.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IImageList.SetOverlayImage
member.summary: Adds a specified image to the list of images used as overlay masks. An image list can have up to four overlay masks in Common Controls version 4.70 and earlier, and up to 15 in version 4.71 or later. The method assigns an overlay mask index to the specified image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the zero-based index of an image in the image list. This index identifies the image to use as an overlay mask.
A value of type int that contains the one-based index of the overlay mask.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes methods that manipulate and interact with image lists.

To use IImageList, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. If you do not do this, Comctl32.dll version 5 will be used by default, with which IImageList could display unpredictable behavior. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.
